elements.label: An Earthquake!
elements.description: The earth's wrath is roused.

elements.label: Strength
Anger
elements.description: Shatter our chains, break our oaths; raise our voices and bare our fists. No defiance is possible without anger.

elements.label: Courage
elements.description: That which overwhelms patience.

elements.label: Woods
elements.description: Not the Wood, thankfully. We can hide here without having to worry about being devoured. Usually.

elements.label: Stellar Residue
elements.description: Remnants of power, cast off from the body of the star as it raced down from heaven. Ephemeral, but potent.

elements.label: Gaspard's Rifle
elements.description: Before the Incident drove the Duffoures from the castle, the one called 'Foe' kept this rifle in his extensive collection of blood-won spoils. My friend ended up sending him a very similar weapon later on, but only to 'make the bastard hideously mad', and Duffoure himself won't use the thing even for kindling. Still, I hear he keeps it for sentimental reasons; this weapon I'll keep for practical ones. Four taenite-iron balls - monster killers - remain.

elements.label: Gaspard's Rifle (Exhausted)
elements.description: Before the Incident drove the Duffoures from the castle, the one called 'Foe' kept this rifle in his extensive collection of blood-won spoils. My friend ended up sending him a very similar weapon later on, but only to 'make the bastard hideously mad', and Duffoure himself won't use the thing even for kindling. Still, I hear he keeps it for sentimental reasons; this weapon I'll keep for practical ones. Three taenite-iron balls - monster killers - remain.

elements.label: Gaspard's Rifle
elements.description: Before the Incident drove the Duffoures from the castle, the one called 'Foe' kept this rifle in his extensive collection of blood-won spoils. My friend ended up sending him a very similar weapon later on, but only to 'make the bastard hideously mad', and Duffoure himself won't use the thing even for kindling. Still, I hear he keeps it for sentimental reasons; this weapon I'll keep for practical ones. Three taenite-iron balls - monster killers - remain.

My friend ended up sending him a very similar weapon later on, but only to 'make the bastard hideously mad', and Duffoure himself won't use the thing even for kindling. Still, I hear he keeps it for sentimental reasons; this weapon I'll keep for practical ones. Two taenite-iron balls - monster killers - remain.

My friend ended up sending him a very similar weapon later on, but only to 'make the bastard hideously mad', and Duffoure himself won't use the thing even for kindling. Still, I hear he keeps it for sentimental reasons; this weapon I'll keep for practical ones. Two taenite-iron balls - monster killers - remain.

elements.label: Gaspard's Rifle (Exhausted)
elements.description: Before the Incident drove the Duffoures from the castle, the one called 'Foe' kept this rifle in his extensive collection of blood-won spoils. My friend ended up sending him a very similar weapon later on, but only to 'make the bastard hideously mad', and Duffoure himself won't use the thing even for kindling. Still, I hear he keeps it for sentimental reasons; this weapon I'll keep for practical ones. Only one taenite-iron ball remains.

elements.label: Gaspard's Rifle
elements.description: Before the Incident drove the Duffoures from the castle, the one called 'Foe' kept this rifle in his extensive collection of blood-won spoils. My friend ended up sending him a very similar weapon later on, but only to 'make the bastard hideously mad', and Duffoure himself won't use the thing even for kindling. Still, I hear he keeps it for sentimental reasons; this weapon I'll keep for practical ones. Only one taenite-iron ball remains.

elements.label: Wormgrinder
elements.description: A crude wood-and-metal trench club, fielded in battle during the Third Worm War. The weapon's head is forged from taenite - star-iron - which is commonly invoked against monsters. And if you invoke it against the skull of someone who isn't a monster, they'll die, too.

elements.label: Wormgrinder (Exhausted)
elements.description: A crude wood-and-metal trench club, fielded in battle during the Third Worm War. The weapon's head is forged from taenite - star-iron - which is commonly invoked against monsters. And f you invoke it against the skull of someone who isn't a monster, they'll die, too.

elements.label: Lion's Claw
elements.description: An eccentric, volatile contraption designed to emulate a spathiurus tail-barb. Highly impractical - the weapon can grow unbearably hot, and the recoil it produces can dislocate a weaker man's shoulder - but the ridiculous force it outputs can penetrate the thickest steel. The inventor has engraved his name on the underside of the mechanism: 'Hokobald of Poscind.'

elements.label: Lion's Claw (Exhausted)
elements.description: An eccentric, volatile contraption designed to emulate a spathiurus tail-barb. Highly impractical - the weapon can grow unbearably hot, and the recoil it produces can dislocate a weaker man's shoulder - but the ridiculous force it outputs can penetrate the thickest steel. The inventor has engraved his name on the underside of the mechanism: 'Hokobald of Poscind.'

elements.label: Unyielding Hilt
elements.description: The Lionsmith does not favour swords, but when he was mortal, this one was his. The rage of his heart still seethes in the hilt, as incandescent as it was all those centuries ago. Take it in hand, and your heart might just burst with the rage that comes.

elements.label: Unyielding Hilt (Exhausted)
elements.description: The Lionsmith does not favour swords, but when he was mortal, this one was his. The rage of his heart still seethes in the hilt, as incandescent as it was all those centuries ago. Take it in hand, and your heart might just burst with the rage that comes.

elements.label: Furious Components
elements.description: Powdered sulphur, jagged leaves of bronze. It could be more, if I had enough on hand.

elements.label: Stymphalian Needle
elements.description: The Lionsmith would set monsters upon his students to test them; the Lionsmith's students would slay his monsters and learn from the slaying. This feather-dart was designed long ago in a fit of epiphany by one such student. Such a tiny point, through which such hideous force is concentrated. [This is a weapon that can only be used once.]

elements.label: Marruvine Idol
elements.description: I remember when the lake was not dry; when the witches of Abruzzo would whisper words to the water and send their little idols in little boats to the twin-gods they loved and feared. In my youth, I stole one such idol from a girl who liked to twist my ears - I think this might even be the same one.

elements.label: Sarcomorphic Gloves
elements.description: Flesh ripples and parts at the touch of these gloves, so one may delve deeply into a body's secrets without need of a scalpel's harshness. And when worn long enough, the gloves begin to writhe like flatworms on the skin - it's quite pleasant, actually.

elements.label: Faccia del Buffone
elements.description: 'What is cunning? Cheating, and then also winning.' Laughter. 'What is courage? A quality pronounced in heroes, and most pronounced in dead heroes.' Laughter. 'And what is war? Why, only an opportunity for a man to escape his wife.' Laughter.

elements.label: Crucifix of St. Lucia
elements.description: An exorcist's tool belonging the Solar Church, which worships the Sun in all his incarnations. Shouting prayers in Italian and thrusting the thing forth like a madman doesn't make it work any better, but it feels wrong to use it without doing so.

elements.label: Patriarch's Urn
elements.description: The first Duffoure to take that name made an understanding with the Dawn before the Division. Another - the disgraced youngest son - was paid to stay far from home, and led a long, bloody career as a lord of thieves and life-takers. There is even one of their lineage who grew immortal, and now fancies herself a Pilgrim. This urn houses a Duffoure who is dead. But even as ash, the blood of the Duffoures - the Blood of the Earth - retains an undeniable power.

elements.label: Strigiphalera
elements.description: Discs like these decorated the breastplates of Roman soldiers who had won distinction on the battlefield - but a soldier who wore the owl in silver was recipient of a special honour; a soldier who wore this could have only earned it fighting on those battlefields that do not belong to the waking world.
